channel.title: Forcibly closing connections
channel.description:
randomly my server throws these messages and forcibly closing all connections to the game causing players to dc. im goin nuts :confused:
posted screen shots of some stuff it says when this happens:
[URL=http://s1362.photobucket.com/user/gmonteiro745/media/error2_zpsf67ea7c9.png.html][IMG]http://i1362.photobucket.com/albums/r688/gmonteiro745/error2_zpsf67ea7c9.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://s1362.photobucket.com/user/gmonteiro745/media/error1_zpse68972e7.png.html][IMG]http://i1362.photobucket.com/albums/r688/gmonteiro745/error1_zpse68972e7.png[/img][/URL]

item.title: Forcibly closing connections
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“th4don, post:8, topic:526254”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=644996.msg4339236#msg4339236 date=1374881580]

dude i dont care what its trying to do i wanna locate source of issue and delete that shit its annoying… keeps dc’ing then wont allow relogging in any idea where to look ?
[/quote]okay, be a dick to someone who is trying to help you diagnose your issue, that gets you somewhere. fück you.

i wasnt saying it like that lol sorry if it sounded like that it was more of a confused statement wasn’t being a dick srry and

I guess this is because the number of clients exceed the backlog set in the listen request of the server…?

sounds right but where do i go to fix this ?[/quote]

  • Sees nerdy post *
  • Says “sounds right” *

I answered you btw.

arham 4:

Your closing your client so the server calls it a froce close.

Read full topic

For the temporary relief of these symptoms associated with menstrual periods:

item.title: Forcibly closing connections
item.dc:creator: @th4don th4don
item.description:
@th4don wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:6, topic:526254”][quote author=th4don link=topic=644996.msg4339037#msg4339037 date=1374848276]
dude i dont care what its trying to do i wanna locate source of issue and delete that shit its annoying… keeps dc’ing then wont allow relogging in any idea where to look ?
[/quote]okay, be a dick to someone who is trying to help you diagnose your issue, that gets you somewhere. fück you.[/quote]

i wasnt saying it like that lol sorry if it sounded like that it was more of a confused statement wasn’t being a dick srry and

ZeIdar:

I guess this is because the number of clients exceed the backlog set in the listen request of the server…?

sounds right but where do i go to fix this ?

Read full topic

th4don:

dude i dont care what its trying to do i wanna locate source of issue and delete that shit its annoying… keeps dc’ing then wont allow relogging in any idea where to look ?

Yeah the problem with your logic there is you should probably figure out what it’s trying to do so that you actually can locate the source of the issue

item.title: Forcibly closing connections
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

I think your server may be trying to close a connection that has already been closed (by the remote host). I could be wrong though.

Read full topic
